result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey L Cholip was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Balance of bail held for Restitution. To be determined at a future hearing.

AS OF 11/04/2015: Restitution was set at ZERO.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations. If Restitution is determined, must also be paid in full to qualify for expungement.

No Contact with J&L Fiber or any of their employees and any co-actors. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 

AS OF 6/24/2016: A NO CONTACT ORDER w/ Matthew Cotton BE LIFTED.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine if it is with or without non-working hours.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stacey L Cholip in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting the no contact with Matthew Cotton provision be lifted as a condition of their probation. State has no objections. Court grants the request. Amended JOC to be done.
Hearing on June 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Undated filed by defendant on today's date requesting probation modification.

Defendant Stacey L Cholip in court, in custody, with attorney Zachery Hoff for Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing. State has not heard anything from the victims. Defense counsel is requesting that restitutition be set at zero. Court grants. Apply any bail to all fine/costs/surcharges and refund the balance to the poster.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief signed by defendant 10/22/15.
Restitution hearing at 11-04-2015 03:00 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Stacey L Cholip in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea as charged in the amended information. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   
 

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  
  -  1 1/2 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 1/2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  J & L Fiber or their employees, co-actors
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION:  to be determined

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

APPLY ANY BAIL THAT IS POSTED, BUT NO REFUND TO BE DONE UNTIL AFTER THE RESTITUTION HEARING

CONDITION TIME: 60 days jail, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stacey L Cholip in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J. McClure.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Daniel Neumann from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the State. Redirect by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing on January 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Stacey L Cholip in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Preliminary Hearing requested within time limitsAtty. Bricco requests to Modify Bail. State objects to any modification of the bail. Court denies the request for any modification of the bail.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.
